content: Did you know you can make your own slime or “goop” for a fun learning and play activity? Non-Newtonian liquids are fascinating for all ages and provide a great learning opportunity about chemistry.

tag: html body div div main div div div p span
content: Find four popular slime recipes below.

tag: html body div div main div div div div div div h2 span
html body div div main div div div div div p span
content: This version of slime (or Gak) is made of glue and Borax.

tag: html body div div main div div div div div div div div h3 span
html body div div main div div div div div div div div ul li span a span
html body div div main div div div div div div div div ul li span

html body div div main div div div div div div div div ol li span
content: In one bowl mix 1 oz. glue (about ¼ of the glue bottle) and ¼ cup water. If you want colored slime, add food coloring to the glue and water mixture. Lift some of the solution out of the container with the stir stick and note what happens.

tag: html body div div main div div div div div div div div ol li span
html body div div main div div div div div div div div ol li a span
html body div div main div div div div div div div div ol li span
content: to the glue and water mixture and stir slowly.

tag: html body div div main div div div div div div div div ol li span
content: The slime will begin to form immediately. Lift some of the solution with the stir stick and observe how the consistency has changed from Step 1.

tag: html body div div main div div div div div div div div ol li span
content: Stir as much as you can, then dig in and knead it with your hands until it gets less sticky. This is a messy experience but is necessary because it

tag: html body div div main div div div div div div div div ol li span
content: allows the two compounds to bond completely. Don’t worry about any

tag: html body div div main div div div div div div div div ol li span
content: leftover water in the bowl; just pour it out.

tag: html body div div main div div div div div div div div ol li span
content: When not in use, store the slime in a plastic bag in the fridge to keep it

tag: html body div div main div div div div div div div div ol li span
html body div div main div div div div div div div div h3 span
html body div div main div div div div div div div div p span
content: The glue has an ingredient called polyvinyl acetate, which is a liquid polymer. The borax links the polyvinyl acetate molecules to each other, creating one large, flexible polymer. This kind of slime will get stiffer and more like putty the more you play with it. Experiment with different glues to see if they create slime (e.g., carpenter glue, tacky glue, etc.).

tag: html body div div main div div div div div div h2 span
html body div div main div div div div div p span
content: The second type of slime is the same clear gooey kind that you see in the

tag: html body div div main div div div div div p span
content: movies. This is the real gooey deal! (This slime is non-toxic, but still keep these chemicals away from unsupervised children and wash your hands after playing with the slime.)

content: Pour ½ cup of the polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) solution into a beaker, jar, or bowl. If you want colored slime, add food coloring to the PVA solution and stir with a stir stick.

tag: html body div div main div div div div div div div div ol li span
html body div div main div div div div div div div div ol li a span
html body div div main div div div div div div div div ol li span
html body div div main div div div div div div div div ol li span
html body div div main div div div div div div div div ol li span
content: Try lifting some of the solution with the stir stick and note what happens.

tag: html body div div main div div div div div div div div ol li span
content: Once the slime has formed, you can play with it. Just don’t eat it!

tag: html body div div main div div div div div div div div ol li span
content: Your slime will last longer if you seal it in a plastic bag and keep it in the

tag: html body div div main div div div div div div div div ol li span
content: fridge, otherwise it will dry out or mold.

tag: html body div div main div div div div div div div div h3 span
html body div div main div div div div div div div div p span
content: Polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) is a liquid polymer and is therefore formed from long chains of connected molecules. The sodium tetraborate forms hydrogen bonds with oxygen present in the PVA chains. Hydrogen bonds occur when the positive charge of the hydrogen atoms attracts the negative charge of the oxygen atoms within the compound. The hydrogen bonds link the individual PVA strands to each other, creating a “blob” of slime. Since hydrogen bonds are weak, they will break and reform as you hold the slime or let it ooze onto a flat surface.

tag: html body div div main div div div div div div h2 span
html body div div main div div div div div p span
content: This slimy substance is made from milk.

tag: html body div div main div div div div div div div div h3 span
html body div div main div div div div div div div div ul li span
html body div div main div div div div div div div div ul li span
html body div div main div div div div div div div div ul li span
html body div div main div div div div div div div div ul li span
html body div div main div div div div div div div div h3 span
html body div div main div div div div div div div div ol li span
content: Add 7 tablespoons of skim milk to a cup and add 1 tablespoon of vinegar

tag: html body div div main div div div div div div div div ol li span
content: to the milk. Gently stir the mixture until solids have formed.

tag: html body div div main div div div div div div div div ol li span
content: Let the solids sink to the bottom of the mixture and then drain off the

tag: html body div div main div div div div div div div div ol li span
content: liquid using a filter (a coffee filter works best). Let the solids drain for a few minutes.

tag: html body div div main div div div div div div div div ol li span
content: Add ¼ teaspoon of baking soda to the solids and knead together to form a slimy mixture from milk.

tag: html body div div main div div div div div div div div h3 span
html body div div main div div div div div div div div p span
content: When you added the vinegar to the milk, it caused the milk’s protein, casein, which is also a polymer, to separate from the liquid part of the milk and clump together to form solids. Casein is used in adhesives, paints, and even plastics. The baking soda neutralizes the acid added, which allows the casein to go back to its liquid form.

tag: html body div div main div div div div div div h2 span
html body div div main div div div div div p span
content: Make a non-Newtonian fluid that resembles quicksand using cornstarch.

tag: html body div div main div div div div div div div div h3 span
html body div div main div div div div div div div div ul li span
html body div div main div div div div div div div div ul li span
html body div div main div div div div div div div div ul li span
html body div div main div div div div div div div div h3 span
html body div div main div div div div div div div div ol li span
content: In the plastic mixing bowl, combine small amounts of water and cornstarch together to form a mixture that looks like heavy whipping cream and has the consistency of honey. The approximate ratio of the cornstarch to water mixture is 2 cups of cornstarch to 1 cup of water. So if you use all of a regular-sized box of cornstarch (about 16 oz.), you will use about 1½ cups of water. It is best to start with less water and slowly add it until the desired consistency is reached.

tag: html body div div main div div div div div div div div ol li span
content: After making your mixture, gently lay your hand on the surface of the cornstarch-water mixture. You should notice that your hand sinks in the mixture like you would expect it to do. Move your hand through the mixture, slowly first and then trying to move it really fast. Was it easier to move your hand slowly or quickly through it?

tag: html body div div main div div div div div div div div ol li span
content: If your mixture is deep enough to submerge your entire hand in it, try grabbing a handful of the mixture and pulling your hand out quickly. Then try again, this time relaxing your hand and pulling it out slowly. Did you notice a difference?

tag: html body div div main div div div div div div div div ol li span
content: Try punching the cornstarch-water mixture. (Be careful not to hurt yourself on the bowl!) Make sure to hit the substance hard and pull your fist back quickly. Did the substance splatter everywhere or did it remain in the bowl? (If it splattered, add more cornstarch.)

tag: html body div div main div div div div div div div div p span
content: Whenever you gently and slowly move your hand through the cornstarch-water mixture, it behaves like a liquid. But when you try to move your hand through it quickly or forcefully hit the substance, it behaves like a solid. This cornstarch-water mixture behaves similarly to quicksand.

tag: html body div div main div div div div div div div div h3 span
html body div div main div div div div div div div div p span
content: The flow and movement of a fluid is affected by its viscosity, or how sticky and thick it is. Quicksand and the cornstarch-water mixture are both non-Newtonian fluids. Non-Newtonian viscosity changes with the type of force applied to it. The viscosity of Newtonian fluids (such as water and honey, which follow Sir Isaac Newton’s law of viscosity) is dependent only on the temperature and pressure of the fluid, not the force applied to it. For instance, warm honey (less viscous) flows much more freely than cold honey (more viscous).

tag: html body div div main div div div div div div div div p span
content: Since the ability of a non-Newtonian fluid to move depends on the force or stress applied to it, these fluids do not act like ones we are more familiar with (e.g., honey or water). A light pressure, such as pouring or gently pressing the cornstarch-water mixture, allows it to move like a liquid.

tag: html body div div main div div div h4 strong span
html body div div main div div div p span
content: Use glue and borax to make a

tag: html body div div main div div div p a span
html body div div main div div div h3 span
html body div div main div div div ol li span
html body div div main div div div ol li a span
html body div div main div div div ol li span
content: “Sodium Tetraborate (Borax) Solution” with a permanent marker.

tag: html body div div main div div div ol li span
content: Fill the bottle about ¾ full with water.

tag: html body div div main div div div ol li span
html body div div main div div div ol li a span
html body div div main div div div ol li span
content: to the water and shake until mostly dissolved.

tag: html body div div main div div div ol li span
content: Fill the bottle to the top with water and shake again to completely dissolve the sodium tetraborate solids.

tag: html body div div main div div div h3 span
html body div div main div div div p span
content: A non-Newtonian liquid is a substance that acts like a liquid in some situations but as a solid in others. Quicksand is an example of a non-Newtonian liquid. It appears to be solid, but if you stand on it, you slowly start sinking as if it were a liquid.

tag: html body div div main div div div p span
content: Polymers are what make non-Newtonian liquids unique. A polymer is a long string of molecules which can exist as a liquid or a solid. The

tag: html body div div main div div div p span
content: term polymer comes from the Greek words for “many parts.” Liquid polymers act as a liquid until particular chemicals are added, which create links between the molecules. These links transform the compound into a hybrid between liquid and solid. Since the molecules are now connected, they cannot move as freely, which gives them the strange properties found in slime. The new compound is called a non-Newtonian liquid.

content: In Deutschland können Sie bis zu 150 EUR ausgeben, ohne dass Steuern für Ihre Bestellung anfallen. Die Mehrwertsteuer beträgt 19% und wird für jede Bestellung von mehr als 22 EUR fällig. Für Zölle und Steuern, die bei der Zustellung erhoben werden, sind Sie verantwortlich.
